title: How to Make Slow Cooker Pizza

steps.headline: Prepare the slow cooker and roll the dough.
steps.description: Turn a 6 quart (5.7 liter) slow cooker on to HIGH. Keep it on HIGH for 20 minutes, so it preheats. Spray the inside of the slow cooker with cooking spray and get out 8 ounces (225 g) of pizza dough. Roll the dough until it's about the shape of the slow cooker. If your slow cooker is smaller, you can decrease the amount of dough in order to get a thin pizza crust.

steps.headline: Place the crust in the cooker and cook it.
steps.description: Carefully transfer the rolled pizza dough to the slow cooker and press it into the bottom of the pan. You'll need to spread and tuck the dough, so a crust forms along the edges. Turn the slow cooker on to HIGH and cook the crust for 1 hour with the lid off. Cooking the dough before adding the toppings helps the crust cook and become a little crisp.

steps.headline: Lay the cheese, any additional toppings, and sauce over the crust.
steps.description: Take 8 ounces (200 g) of sliced mozzarella cheese and lay the slices on the cooked crust. They should overlap each other and the cover the crust. If you want to add meat, you can lay 8 ounces (230 g) of thinly sliced pepperoni over the cheese slices. Spread 1/2 cup (115 g) of pizza sauce over the toppings and sprinkle 1 tablespoon of grated Parmesan on top. You could use any cooked meat instead of the pepperoni or use your favorite sliced vegetables.

steps.headline: Cook the pizza.
steps.description:
Turn the slow cooker on to HIGH and leave the lid off. Cook the pizza for 1 hour to 1 1/2 hours. The top of the pizza should appear cooked and the crust should be dark brown. Use a large spatula to carefully lift the whole pizza out of the slow cooker. Slice the pizza and garnish it with:
6 fresh basil leaves, sliced into strips
1 pinch of crushed red pepper

methods.name: Making Deep Dish Slow Cooker Pizza

steps.headline: Roll the pizza dough and fit it into the slow cooker.
steps.description: Get out 1 pound (45g) of pizza dough and place it on a large sheet of parchment paper. Use a rolling pin to roll the dough into a large oval that's 2-inches (5 cm) longer and 2-inches (5 cm) wider than your slow cooker. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of cornmeal over both sides of the dough. Lower the parchment paper with the dough into the slow cooker. If you're using frozen pizza dough, let it thaw in the fridge until it's soft enough to handle.

steps.headline: Saute the shallot and garlic.
steps.description: Put 3 tablespoons of butter in a large skillet and turn it on to medium. While the butter melts, peel and dice 1 shallot and 2 cloves of garlic. Add the shallot to the butter and saute it for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the garlic and saute the mixture for another 2 minutes. Shallots have a strong, concentrated flavor. If you'd like to substitute onion, you could dice and use half of one onion.

steps.headline: Stir in and simmer crushed tomatoes with seasonings.
steps.description: Open one 28 ounce (794 g) can of crushed tomatoes and add it to the skillet along with 2 teaspoons of dried Italian seasoning, 1 1/2 teaspoons of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of salt. If you want to add meat, you could stir in 1/2 pound (230 g) of cooked Italian pork sausage. You could also substitute ground beef or scatter pepperoni over the pizza crust.

steps.headline: Spread the cheese and sauce over the crust.
steps.description: Sprinkle 2 cups (200 g) of shredded Italian blend cheese over the crust in the slow cooker. If you want to use any pepperoni, sprinkle it over the crust. Pour the tomato sauce evenly over the cheese. If the edges of the crust are hidden by cheese, you may need to lift and pull on the sides of the dough to make them stand out.

steps.headline: Cook the deep dish pizza.
steps.description: Unroll a long piece of paper towel, so you can lay it across the entire length of the slow cooker. Set the lid on the slow cooker, so the paper towel is held in place. Turn the cooker on to HIGH and cook the pizza for 2 to 4 hours. You can also cook it on LOW for 4 to 6 hours. The crust should cook completely and the cheese will melt once it's finished baking. The paper towel will catch any of the moisture from the lid. This will prevent it from dripping onto the pizza, which could make it soggy.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve the pizza.
steps.description: Remove the lid and paper towel from the slow cooker. Grab the parchment paper and slowly lift the pizza up and out of the slow cooker. Sprinkle the pizza with extra parmesan cheese and freshly chopped parsley. Slice it and serve the pizza immediately. Use caution when you lift the hot pizza out of the oven. You may want to wear oven mitts.

methods.name: Making Slow Cooker Pull-Apart Pizza Bake

steps.headline: Grease the slow cooker and cut the biscuits.
steps.description: Spray a slow cooker insert with cooking spray and place it in a 6 quart (5.7 liter) slow cooker. Get out 1 can (16.3 ounces or 462 g) of refrigerated biscuits and open it. Remove the 8 biscuits and cut each biscuit into 6 pieces. Put the biscuits in a large mixing bowl. You can use a sharp knife or kitchen shears to cut the biscuits.

steps.headline: Cut the pepperoni and toss it with the biscuits and seasoning.
steps.description: Measure out 1 cup (150 g) of sliced pepperoni and cut each slice into 4 pieces. Add the pepperoni to the mixing bowl with the biscuits and sprinkle 1 tablespoon of Italian seasoning over it. Stir the mixture, so the biscuits are coated. If you don't have Italian seasoning, you can use a mixture of dried sage, oregano, rosemary, thyme, and marjoram to equal 1 tablespoon.

steps.headline: Place the biscuits in the slow cooker with the sauce and cheese.
steps.description: Dump the seasoned biscuits and pepperoni into the prepared slow-cooker and pour 1 cup (225 g) of pizza sauce evenly over it. Spread 2 cups (200 g or 8 ounces) of shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce. For an extra-rich pizza, consider sprinkle extra chopped pepperoni over the top of the pull-apart pizza bake.

steps.headline: Cook the pull-apart pizza bake.
steps.description: Unroll a long piece of paper towel, so you can lay it across the entire length of the slow cooker. Set the lid on the slow cooker, so the paper towel is held in place. Cook the bake on HIGH for 1 1/2 hours to 2 hours. Check to see if the bake is done by sticking a knife into the center of the bake. The knife should come out clean and the edges of the bake should be golden. Carefully lift the insert out of the slow cooker and remove the bake. The paper towel will catch any of the moisture from the lid. This will prevent it from dripping onto the pizza, which could make it soggy.
